root: ^High Error Rate in Android API ðŸš¨

start_investigation: ^It's 3 AM, and your phone is screaming with alerts! ðŸ˜± High error rate in the Android API! Your heart races, your eyes blur. It's incident response time! â˜•
^Check the Android API APM. (Time to investigate!)
^Ignore the alert for now. (But the app might be on fire!)
analyze_apm: ^You check the Android API APM. Throughput is unusually high compared to the previous day/week. (Something's fishy!)
^Itâ€™s a potential DDoS attack! (Uh oh, incoming traffic tsunami!)
^Itâ€™s a transient spike. (Are you sure you want to gamble with the app's stability?)
check_order_dashboard_question: ^You check the order dashboard to see if order placement is impacted. (Are customers getting hangry?)
^Q: How to check if there is order impact? (Where's the order panic button?)
check_order_dashboard_answer: ^We can check the impact on orders by checking the Shopping Dashboard. (Hold your breath!)
^No impact on orders or customer experience affected.
create_incident: ^You determine that the high error rate impacts order placement. (Time to sound the alarm!)
^Identify Attack Pattern. (Let's hunt down the culprit!)
identify_attack_pattern: ^You begin identifying the attack pattern using New Relic Transaction Queries and Cloudflare Security Analytics. (Time to put on your detective hat!)
^New Relic Alert
^Cloudflare Security Analytics
investigate_ja3: ^You identify that most of the attacks share the same JA3 fingerprint. (Aha! A digital fingerprint!)
^JA3 is a method of creating a unique fingerprint for SSL/TLS clients based on the parameters they use during a connection.
^HINT: Learn more here
^Investigate JA3 across the last week/month. (Let's track down this digital bandit!)
^No need to check JA3 analysis; Iâ€™ll just stare at CF and hope for clarity. (Hope is not a strategy, my friend!)
create_firewall_rule: ^Now you need to create a new Cloudflare firewall rule to match requests with the same JA3 causing the attack. (Time to build a digital fortress!)
^HINT: Use this reference for creating rules:
^Set the rule to log only. (Let's be cautious and observe first!)
^Immediately block traffic. (But what if you block legitimate users?)
monitor_firewall: ^You monitor the rule for a few minutes and confirm it matches the expected attack throughput. (Looking good so far!)
^Change the action to block. (Time to unleash the firewall!)
^Continue monitoring. (But the attackers are still slipping through!)
share_with_security: ^You share the new firewall rule with the security team for validation and documentation. (Teamwork makes the dream work!)
^Some requests still pass. (Uh oh, the attackers are finding loopholes!)
investigate_remaining_requests: ^You observe that some attack requests are bypassing the firewall rules. (The attackers are evolving!)
^Refine the firewall rule. (Time to strengthen the defenses!)
evaluate_results: ^The majority of the attack has been mitigated. (Victory is in sight!)
^Monitor & Escalate to engineering/security. (Let's keep an eye on things and plan for the future!)
monitor_traffic: ^You decide to monitor the situation further without taking immediate action. (But the app is still under siege!)
^Escalate the issue. (Time to call in the reinforcements!)
ignore_alert: ^Ignoring the alert could lead to severe consequences. (Are you sure you want to risk it?)
^Go back and take action. (Let's be responsible!)
^Yes, ignore for now. (You're playing a dangerous game!)
DONE: ^Collaborate with the security team for further analysis and prevention strategies.
